scenario:
Fiserv recently announced a buyback authorization of 60 million shares, bringing its total buyback capacity to approximately 78 million shares, valued at over $18 billion, or nearly 14% of its market capitalization. The company has a history of utilizing its buyback capacity, spending $5.5 billion on repurchases in 2024, a 120% increase from 2022. Fiserv's share price has risen 103% since the end of 2022, indicating the company's aggressive repurchase strategy.

Analog Devices announced a new buyback program of $10 billion, bringing its total buyback capacity to approximately $11.5 billion, or 9.8% of its market capitalization. The company also increased its dividend by 8%, giving it an indicated dividend yield of nearly 1.7%, which is strong compared to its sector and industry peers. Analog Devices uses its buyback capacity more slowly than Fiserv, averaging $760 million in repurchases per year over the past 21 years.

Allison Transmission announced an additional $1 billion share buyback authorization, bringing its total buyback capacity to $5 billion, or 59% of its market capitalization. The company spent $250 million on buying back shares in 2024, a significant pace compared to its relatively low market cap. Allison Transmission has posted an impressive total return of 163% over the last three years, with record full-year sales and diluted EPS in 2024.
